Professor Soontae Kim and Ph.D. student Seokin Hong won a best paper award in 2010 IEEE International Conference on Computer Design held in Amsterdam, Nethelands. Only five best papers were awarded out of 79 papers presented in the conference. Its title is "Lizard: Energy-efficient Hard Fault Detection, Diagnosis, and Isolation in the ALU". The ALU is designed in a modular fashion so that it can detect and isolate a faulty portion of the ALU, and continue its operation without a stop as lizards regenerate lost tails.
